channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #122 - Over 5_000!
item.description:
Hi,

let me just thank you for all the support. There are now more than 5_000 e-mail subscribers reading this newsletter. It is awesome!

item.title: Back-End Blacksmith
item.description: Do you take pride in your craft and want to have fun() at the same time? Are you a geek? Join the team of iwantmyname from anywhere.

item.title: Foswiki 1.1.9 released, just in time for its 5th anniversary
How to command the command line?
item.description: Perl one-liners written by Peteris Krumins has just been published by No Starch Press. Read my review and if you would like to buy it, you can use the discount code PERLWEEKLY. It's 30% off and is valid for the next 10 days.

item.title: The strict Pragma is a Cultural Marker
item.description: Do you have special feelings when you see code that has 'use strict' in it? What if you notice that it does NOT have 'use strict'? How does that change your expectation from the code? How do you see your future with that code?

item.title: PDL show of hands
item.description: Chris Marshall, the maintainer of PDL (Perl Data Language) distribution, is lookinf for input for the future direction of PDL. Please read the questions on the announcement, and send an e-mail to him to: devel.chm.01 at gmail.com

item.title: Claiming your CPAN authorship at Google
item.description: Are you a CPAN author? Do you think that your module is useful? Even to people who use Google as their search engine? Here is a way you can help Google show your module in a more personal way.

item.title: Test::Class::MOP now has an 'is testcase' trait
item.description: Ovid continues his work on the perl5-mop based port of Test::Class.

item.title: Oh My Glob
item.description: Do you know how import works in Perl? Do you know what \*STDOUT means? Do you know how to create a function on the fly? Rob Hoelz explains all that.

item.title: watson - inline issue manager with GitHub support
Something Fishy
item.description: Command-line perldoc, dzil and got completion from your favorite Yanick. Screenshows.

item.title: Perl Website Survey
item.description: Andrew Solomon is running a small, one-page survey on Perl and web. Please fill it out in the next 48 hours and if you don't forget, please mention that you read about the survey in the Perl weekly. (I think the 5th question can have this information).

item.title: Built In Perl
item.description: Tudor Constantin has built a new web site featuring start-up companies that rely on Perl. Do you work for one? Do you own one? Do you want to get featured?

item.title: HOWTO: Building Perl Module DBD::Sybase 1.15 for ActiveState Perl (Windows 32bit) 5.16.3 using the MinGW compiler
item.description: Jason L Froebe walks you through the steps. Enhanced with screenshots.

item.title: Building your first app using MongoDB and Perl
How To Be A Web UI Developer
item.description: (48:55) - Casey West gives a quick overview of Twitter Bootstrap, HTML5 Boilerplate, Modernizr, Shims, Respond.js, Mimosa, Stylus, and a lot of other front-end tools and libraries.

item.title: A Date with Perl
item.description: (52:18) Dave Rolsy, author of the DateTime module explains about Daylight Saving Time, Leap seconds and the difficulty to make sane computation with dates and times.

item.title: How to get the last character of a string in Perl?
item.description: An almost legitimate use-case for chop!

item.title: Count the frequency of words in text using Perl
item.description: Counting how many times a given (sub)string appears in a given text is a very common task where Perl is a perfect fit.

item.title: Hacking Meta::CPAN - the first steps
item.description: Do you use MetaCPAN or search.cpan.org? Do you know you easily make changes to MetaCPAN to provide you better information? In this article I show the first few steps and a small change that was already accepted and deployed.

item.title: London Perl Workshop (LPW 2013)
item.description: Saturday 30th November 2013 at Westminster University

item.title: German Perl Workshop (GPW 2014)
item.description: March 26-28, 2014, Hannover, Germany

item.title: YAPC::NA 2014
item.description: June 23-25, 2014, Orlando FL
